issue.title: world frame does not go with tf across network

content.raw:
Well if the robot pose is relative to the world frame then we can infer the world frame from the pose. This only works as long as the pose is accurately locked to the world frame. This way we could get the transform from the foot to the pelvis then add the pose to get the current position of the foot relative to the world. Then we add whatever delta we want to this value and set that as the world frame position of the next footstep which is what the controller wants. That is a lot of if's.

Is there anyway to get around the requirement that we provide data relative to the world frame?
